abstract.text: Defined contexts in which an intent or activity might be relevant to a user.

inlineContent.text: The system uses the set of availability options in a donated shortcut to provide the user with shortcuts relevant in a particular context or circumstance. For example, a meditation app could include an intent with
. Then the Wind Down configuration screen in the Health app includes that intent in the Mindfulness category when guiding the user to set up shortcuts.
Provide accurate availability options when you suggest shortcuts to
, and when you donate shortcuts based on user actions. If none of the options apply to an intent, provide an empty
Most shortcuts should specify a single activity type, but you can use an option set with more than one category if a shortcut really doesn’t fit neatly into a single category.
For more information on donating shortcuts effectively, see

abstract.text: Tell Siri about shortcuts to actions that the user performed in your app.
A type that presents a mathematical set interface to a bit set.
A set of defined contexts in which an intent or activity might be relevant to a user.
Empower people to customize interactions for your app on their device.
An interaction between the user and your app involving an intent object.
An action available in your app that the system may suggest to a user or a user may add to Siri.
Defined contexts in which an intent or activity might be relevant to a user.
Returns the set of availability categories represented by the given value.
Writing and other daily logging activities.
Meditation and other activities intended to facilitate mindfulness.
Music suitable for falling asleep.
A podcast or other spoken audio.
A book or other reading material.
An activity in preparation for sleep such as personal grooming or reviewing the next day’s agenda.
Physical activity to prepare for sleep.
An object representing an action available in your app that the system may suggest to a user or a user may add to Siri.
A shortcut the user added to Siri.
Retrieve the user’s shortcuts and make shortcut suggestions.
Suggests shortcuts the user may want to add to Siri.
Reveal your app’s shortcuts inside the Health app.
Add custom intents and parameters to help users interact more quickly and effectively with Siri and the Shortcuts app.
